captions.text:
From the man responsible for every movie your
girlfriend tried to drag you to

comes the film responsible for every bad movie
about a dozen famous people falling in love

This holiday season, prepare for the ultimate
romantic comedy
or relevant to the holiday season.

"They've been giving out parts in the nativity
play!"

But don't worry: sit through it and you
still might get laid.
Follow along on this Pulp Fiction for girls,

stuffed with eight different plot-lines that
are creepy and depressing when you actually
stop to think about them, like...

a man getting over the death of his wife by
helping his kid seduce a girl with the same

a woman who ends up alone with her unstable
brother instead of her hot available coworker

this guy who's trying to bang his best friend's
wife...

a man who will throw away his loving wife
and children to buy a
"Full of dark corners for doing dark deeds."

a powerful older man who fires his subordinate
for being distractingly hot,

a powerful older man whose wife cheats on
him...

so he seduces his young hot subordinate who
doesn't even speak English,

and these two uncomfortable stand-ins on the
highest budget porno of all time.

Experience what boils down to a supercut of
every rom-com cliche in the book, like
"I thought you didn't know my name."

"It's Junction 13. That's just murder, isn't
it - total gridlock this morning."

making out behind the curtain and getting
discovered,

So this Christmas, catch one of the most subversive
chick flicks of all time
that's aimed at a female audience

but tells them the ideal woman brings you
food,

"I think there's a pretty sizable ass
there, yes. Huge thighs."

all these people you likes better in other
things.

Rick. For real! I'm telling you, that's totally
Rick.
Oh of course Mr. Bean's in it
Elizabeth from Pirates of the Caribbean
and the voice of Marceline on Adventure Time

Wow. All that's missing is someone from
Breaking Bad...
It's the Grey Matter guy from Breaking Bad!

comments.text:
Instead of doing grand romantic gestures for your girl, just be a dick 
year-round that trash-talks rom-coms... then grudgingly agree to go see one 
once per year. Your gf will feel like that's a grand romantic gesture, and 
feel reassured that while you're too manly to admit your feelings she knows 
that deep down you're a softy. It's either that or go broke spending a 
fortune on grand romantic gestures that just set her expectations so high 
you'll constantly have to top yourself or she'll think you're a jerk that 
doesn't worship her anymore. Meh... it's good to be lazy.﻿
